qas.question: When did the Florida land boom occur?
What year saw the crash of the Miami housing market?
Where does the area around Miami rank nationally in terms of foreclosures?
Along with its political corruption, why did Forbes call Miami the country's second most miserable city in 2011?
In what year did Forbes call Miami the country's most miserable city?
When did the Florida land bust occur?
What year saw the boom of the Miami housing market?
Where does the area around Miami rank internationally in terms of foreclosures?
Along with its political corruption, why did Forbes call Miami the country's second most miserable city in 2001?
In what year did Forbes call Miami the country's least miserable city?

context: During the mid-2000s, the city witnessed its largest real estate boom since the Florida land boom of the <a0_0><b5_0>1920s<b5_0/><a0_0/>. During this period, the city had well over a hundred approved high-rise construction projects in which 50 were actually built. In <a1_0><b6_0>2007<b6_0/><a1_0/>, however, the housing market crashed causing lots of foreclosures on houses. This rapid high-rise construction, has led to fast population growth in the city's inner neighborhoods, primarily in Downtown, Brickell and Edgewater, with these neighborhoods becoming the fastest-growing areas in the city. The Miami area ranks <a2_0><b7_0>8th<b7_0/><a2_0/> in the nation in foreclosures. In 2011, Forbes magazine named Miami the second-most miserable city in the United States due to its <a3_0><b8_0>high foreclosure rate<b8_0/><a3_0/> and past decade of corruption among public officials. In <a4_0><b9_0>2012<b9_0/><a4_0/>, Forbes magazine named Miami the most miserable city in the United States because of a crippling housing crisis that has cost multitudes of residents their homes and jobs. The metro area has one of the highest violent crime rates in the country and workers face lengthy daily commutes.
